title: 110_hr4080
content: Establishment of new fashion model nonimmigrant classification. Establishment of new fashion model nonimmigrant classification. Amendment to Immigration and Nationality Act to include distinguished fashion models seeking temporary entry for modeling services. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to include distinguished fashion models seeking temporary entry for modeling services. This includes a numerical limitation of 1,000 visas or nonimmigrant statuses for fashion models in any fiscal year. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to include a numerical limitation for principal aliens, not including spouses or children. An alien can only be counted once towards the limitation during the same period of stay. Consultation requirements are expanded to include clause (iv) in addition to clauses (i), (iii). Advisory opinion provisions are also amended. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to include expedited procedures for artists, entertainers, or fashion models. The H-1B classification for fashion models is eliminated. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to remove certain criteria for fashion models, with the changes taking effect upon enactment of the Act. Regulations and guidelines for adjudicating petitions for fashion models will be applied to new petitions under the amended section. The Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to remove criteria for fashion models, with regulations by the Secretary of Homeland Security. Alien fashion models can still obtain nonimmigrant status under specific conditions, and pending petitions for fashion models will be treated accordingly. Pending petitions for fashion models under section 1101(a)(15)(H)(i)(b) will be treated as if filed under section 101(a)(15)(P)(iv) of the Immigration and Nationality Act.
